content.description: A very enjoyable 5.9 that always draws a crowd.
content.location: This is the second bolted route to the left of Little Nest, directly to the left of Perception vs Reality.  The start is on a white splash of rock.  The name is at the base.

content.description: Dihedral left of Sweet Adene. Mix of finger crack and face holds, and merges with Sweet Adene at the top to the anchors. Crux is pulling the move over the jutting rock at the top.
content.location: Located between the bolts for Mean Adene and Sweet Adene.

content.description: A great 5.8 for the area.  The crux is a small roof above the 5th bolt.
content.location: 3nd anchors from the left on the Populace Wall.

content.description: This is a chimney climb.  It has great gear placements all the way up.  I'd say the crux is a small buldge about 3/4 the way up.  Great climb to practice placements on.
content.location: Look for the obvious chimney about fifteen feet to the left when the trail ends.

content.description: Pretty straightforward Black Cliffs 5.7 trad climbing. There are two dihedrals you can climb for the first half, the left of which had positive edges of all sizes, nice finger and hand jams, and some blocky moves toward the top. Not classic by any means but it's a worthwhile easy trad lead or TR for your newbie friends.
content.protection:
Small to hand sized gear

Old anchor recently replaced with bomber 1/2" bolts courtesy of ASCA.

content.description:
Straightforward offwidth crack that leads to anchors for Stems and Jammies.

Numerous crimps available both left and right if youâ€™re inclined to use them.
content.protection: Gear to 6 inches plus a small piece or two for the top.
content.location: Just right of the S & J dihedral.

content.description: The crux is moving over the bulge, after the last bolt, to the anchors.  Get creative with your footwork and you will send.
content.location: The anchors between White Wash and Little Nest.

content.description: Climb the finger crack between White Wash and Perception vs. Reality until it ends.  Veer left to finish on White Wash anchors,(5.8) or go right to finish out on Perception vs Reality(5.10a). Either way is worthwhile.
content.protection: Standard rack with emphasis on small gear. You can clip the bolt crux bolt on Perception vs Reality if you go that way.
content.location: In Between White Wash and Perception vs Reality.

content.description: Fun bolted line just left of Sweet Adene.  There is a crux down low, and then there are well spaced giant jug ledges the most of the rest of the way.  Fun crux sequence at the top finishes it out.

This climb is a jug haul. Big huge holds that you can get both hands on. It is a great first lead for somebody. It's four bolts to chains. The crux comes on the last move. You step out from a ledge onto a face and pull onto another ledge.
content.protection: Quickdraws or you can lead it on gear. You'll need bigger cams up to #6 for the offwidth and some stoppers for the finish.
content.location: Once you get to Populace Wall it is to the right about two climbs.

content.description: Crack to chains right next to Mean Adene. Hand crack to top of column then face climb to small overhang use hand crack finish to chains
content.protection: size1- 3 camelot for the column a few small nuts and a hand sized piece up top or clip the last bolt of mean adene
content.location: Between School days and mean adene just to climbers left of sweet adene

content.description: Directly left of Stems and Jammies. The route name is painted at the base. Great pro until just below the top, where the crack widens and flares out before stopping abruptly. The moves after are somewhat balancy and slabby.
content.protection: Lots of small gear, BD .5 and below with one .75 for the wider crack below the crux.

content.description: No single crux.  Just sustained, enjoyable moves.
content.location: Just to the right of Sweet Adene
